resources.string:
At the start of a player's turn you have the ability to select any one of the 5 pipes in the green pipe queue. Once a pipe is selected, it will be placed on the game board and is available to move or rotate. There are also 4 buttons a player can use: 

 1. Add a pipe: adds the pipe that was selected from the queue to the current player's path, given the pipe is in a valid location.

 2. Discard pipe: discards any pipe that was selected from the queue and allows you to touch one of the 5 pipes in the queue to change it to one of the other 3 types of pipes (used to strategically keep pipes your opponent needs out of the queue). A player can go back to adding a pipe if they press the add pipe button before discarding a pipe from the queue.

 3. Open valve: opens the current player's starting valve, resulting in a win if there is a leak free path from the start to the finish.

 4. Surrender: the current player concedes the current game.
Invalid Move: there is already a pipe in that location.
Invalid Move: there is no connection point between this pipe and another pipe on your path.
Invalid Move: you may not place a pipe on your opponents path.
Invalid Move: you may not place directly to the end pipe without connecting to another pipe.
